qas.question: How many eople died in Breuit because of unrest caused by Nasser's death?
How many people marched in Jerusalem?
Who said, "The world will never again see five million people crying together?"
What did a Lebanese publication call the Arabs following Nasser's death?

context: Because of his ability to motivate nationalistic passions, "men, women, and children wept and wailed in the streets" after hearing of his death, according to Nutting. The general Arab reaction was one of mourning, with thousands of people pouring onto the streets of major cities throughout the Arab world. <a0_0>Over a dozen<a0_0/> people were killed in Beirut as a result of the chaos, and in Jerusalem, roughly <a1_0>75,000<a1_0/> Arabs marched through the Old City chanting, "Nasser will never die." As a testament to his unchallenged leadership of the Arab people, following his death, the headline of the Lebanese Le Jour read, "One hundred million human beings—the Arabs—are <a3_0>orphans<a3_0/>." <a2_0>Sherif Hetata<a2_0/>, a former political prisoner and later member Nasser's ASU, said that "Nasser's greatest achievement was his funeral. The world will never again see five million people crying together."
